str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A crown, garland, honor, glory. From an apparently primary stepho; a chaplet, literally or figuratively.
The act of boasting, glorying, exultation. From kauchaomai; boasting, in a good or a bad sense.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
By no means, not at all. Intensive of ou; not indeed.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From en and pros; in front of (literally or figuratively) or time).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the present participle of pareimi; a being near, i.e. Advent; physically, aspect.
